page.title: 06TREGONNING HILL (1)
page.content:
{Tregonning Hill}is a large granite hill mass which lies to the north of the village of Ashton.It has had three distinct periods of human settlement and activity.
The probable origin of the name {Tregonning}was from a chieftain called {Connan}who lived on the hill and {Tre}being a Cornish word for homestead. This has changed to {Treconnan}meaning "the homestead of Connan" and, eventually, Tregonning.
Around 700 A.D. there was an influx of Irish / Celtic saints. Among these was a St. Breaca who arrived at Hayle and set up her first church at Ttegonning Hill.
